BHmF2pWm6LW210bs5vNDLA.text: This place has wonderful food at a wonderful price.  The servers are very hard working as well!

rNj2A7vWeBTkBRvmxmpypQ.text: Best Mexican food and strawberry margaritas in charlotte. Great cheese dip, tacos, and fajitas

EMypnTEBIL0B2WO550KYTA.text: Tried the restaurant for dinner. Food was good and pretty authentic Mexican food. Prices were very reasonable and beer was cold. $2.50 for a draft beer is a great price. Had the fajitas and they were certainly acceptable. Limited beans, rice, guacamole and sour cream though. Worth a stop if you are in the area.

Ji22Ohtcvl8slF9EBvW8Yg.text: what an amazing restaurant ...quaint, clean and friendly reasonable prices and the food was great with a unique taste.   There was a constant in flow of customers the entire time we were there.  Put it as a don't miss if you are flying out of Charlotte.

5zLPaX_rsMsUmzDsqdNytA.text: Miguel's is a nice local spot right by the airport. It is a refreshing change to the chain options in the area and the food is incredible.   We were seated right away even during lunchtime and given chips and salsa right off the bat. The salsa came in a small carafe with a little bowl for each of us so we could have our own.   I ordered the chicken soup with was delicious. The broth had wonderful flavor and the ingredients were all fresh and flavorful. It was a nice lite lunch (there was a menu full of more filling options). Everything on the menu looked delicious. I'll be adding Miguel's to my list whenever I am making a lunchtime airport trip!  There is easy parking but it is a bit of a loop around the major roads so I'd recommend using GPS the first time you go.

photos.caption: Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chips and salsa

KRLnoFfzFEP4T5_7ShwrVg.text: Food was very good and reasonably priced with an excellent sanitation grade. Only negative is the small and old space.

vSEap-qhY3vKi-lkqeMZWQ.text: It was pretty good. I got fish tacos and shrimp Cajun style. It was a little greasy for my taste but I will override that because they gave me avocado  lol. It definitely makes most things taste better.

photos.caption: Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

qBRAluG094_iPxYg7h0rSQ.text: First time, great experience.  Went with our family of 6 and thoroughly enjoyed it. The queso was delicious, tacos & burritos were great, and chips/salsa were spot on.  Loved the environment & atmosphere- it's small, but legit. We'll be back.

SMI8veXn1-svqZtIgaeFPw.text: I just can't figure out how this place gets such high reviews!  Been here twice and the experience was exactly the same. Crappy, unfriendly service and bland food at its most basic. Don't expect prompt service and good luck getting any staffers to smile. We sat outside in the rundown open air covered section. Not even sure what to call it lol!  This wasn't that bad, but when combined with the forgettable food and pathetic service that makes you feel like an interruption, it just isn't worth the stop. If you're looking for cheap, no frills food with a side of arrogance then you'll be satisfied. Otherwise try a different spot. There's no lack of Mexican fare in Charlotte!

4-m6eSeiDDpjOjhC8tZplQ.text: Fantastic food!  Best Mexican I've had in years!  Place isn't much to look at but it was packed for a Monday night. Despite that was able to get a seat right away.

8-vU_DwjOZYRrMEK0joRlw.text: My brother wanted to eat Mexican food, And I'm the type of person who doesn't like to try new things and I'm so glad that I went to this restaurant. Their food was great! I loved the cheese and chips while we were waiting for our food to be made. Overall I loved this place!

V0TVOfmpQNzmIG_TTpX1Ng.text: I ordered to-go via postmates. The shrimp tacos were VERY well seasoned. Besides the retried beans that were filled inside the tacos, I didn't get any extra in the side like I'm accustomed to with he other Mexican restaurant I frequent. I honestly wish I could've had another taco instead of two made it three with some extra re fried beans on the side. I also ordered some guacamole, the consistency wasn't to my liking, almost a little thin. Like it wasn't prepared fresh. Anyway because the shrimp tacos were good, I would definitely order from them with postmates again. However bc the location is far from where I live I don't think I'd ever actually go to the physical location myself.

ZUI5xUrKTb5f8HMptyCX-w.text: Salsa is amazing but that's all the compliment that I can give them. One waitress for the entire restaurant and she doubles as the busboy and bartender. She isn't very friendly either. You walk in and expect a warm welcome but instead you hear someone yelling "how many?" and then points to the table she wants you to sit at. Took about 10 minutes just to order drinks, another 10 minutes to receive drinks and probably about 20 minutes to order. God forbid if you need a refill... Even though the salsa is great, I do not recommend dining here. The wait time is long and the service is appalling.

T63Ht9XOPgMcm5UXwVQgtg.text: Food was great . It was a full house with alot of Hurricane evacuees. . The service omg. . They barely said 2 words to us. And just threw the food in the table and ran away.  I know they were busy, but come on a little bit of hospitality never killed anyone...

photos.caption: Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

V7FX5IZTS1S93ENumHqbOQ.text: This place is a "no-frills" restaurant. The food is delicious. Don't expect to be pampered. You can expect good food at cheap prices.

HcHSY4Ys88P0z2tIMS5t1g.text: Fantastic food, total hole in the wall, love this place!  Really busy so our waitress was grumpy- but food is amazing

knmUckPbfUJkgprFmlxcFA.text: I was really in need of a to-go order of chicken soup to battle a cold, so I searched Yelp for suggestions within the area that I work. I could NOT have made a better choice. In addition to having the very best chicken soup that I've ever had in my life, I also ordered 1 beef crispy taco, and had some chips and salsa.   Miguel's is a neat and clean restaurant with a consistent good health grade - most being 95 and above. Like the old cliche: "don't judge a book by its cover" because you'll be losing out on an awesome meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sopo pollo had huge chunks of white chicken, avocado, rice, onion and pico gallo!
Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside of breezeway
Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. The breezeway!  I really just want to sit here and sip margaritas!

3Ll3izgPTakv2Flc6squRA.text: love the food, but fyi no pets allowed. we were looking for a quick bite with our well behaved dog, we certainly planned to eat outside. so just a heads up- don't stop in unless your sans pet. :/

0xfVY8iwbEsAU3WwyhdBqg.text: I used to go to Miguel's at least once a week, I live right down the street from them. I love the food, the service and the price but lately I have noticed that the amount of food doesn't seem to be the same. If you like fancy places this is not the place for you, it is simple but very cozy.

6Nvo_OLZFy3_7LYpg8Msew.text: Good food, cheap prices but slow service. The place was packed. Recommend if not on a tight schedule.

4ru48dUHhxms-RxR8yphfA.text: This is truly a hidden gem and if your aren't paying attention might miss it. Pulling up to it I just knew the food was going to be good. There's an outside patio around that you walk into then the door. We just grabbed a sit & a server come and gave us a menu. There's a lot on the menu so it took me awhile to decide but went with my favorite which are nachos and they were so good and it's a really good portion. The margaritas were nice are strong. The serve wasn't bad just straight to the point and we didn't have to wait too long for our food or drinks.

59ZKpflZqxfO7nNPxd550A.text: So, I decided I  wanted Mexican and didn't want to drive to my favorite spot in Azteca. I found this place about 8 minutes from me and decided to give it a try. I was very skeptical about the location but said why not.  I'm pleasantly surprised, I had the spinach enchilada and added chicken. It was good and well seasoned. I also got chips on the side which were good as well. Would definitely try again.

photos.caption: Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZxZBdb1rgzZm0a1a3hPLwg.text: LOVE THIS PLACE! Thought it was so sketchy when we pulled up. We almost turned around and left. So glad we didn't! Friendly staff. Good food. Good prices. Great Margaritas!! Best place I've visited in the area.

32EOpkqWFOgBuKCoDbGaSw.text: Fajita for two. Four different kinds of meat: shrimp, steak, pork and chicken. A bit too oily but I guess it wouldn't taste that good if you don't put that much grease into it. Also comes with plenty tortilla bread.

photos.caption: Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fajitas for two

HqTLgUbpBRiB2dzCf-q3eg.text: I love this place! Once I got over the "late night truck stop - I'm going to be kidnapped and drug to the abandoned hotel & held for ransom" the experience was great! The food is fresh and off the chain! Some of the best chicken I have tasted. Been a long time since I've ate at a Mexican joint and had chicken taste like chicken! The salsa, the chips, the food, AND the price for a family of 7 FAR outweighs the lack of curb appeal. I (we) will be a regular!

WQKPASQ72VEh6_J87t-bYA.text: Traveling by air to Denver so drove to Charlotte night before. Asked hotel staff recommendations and Miguel's was on their list of close to Hampton Inn. I was always taught don't judge a book by its cover.  This is truly a "hole in wall" local restaurant.   We lived in Texas for 25 years and were used to excellent Tex-Mex food.  Miguel's is comparable to most in Lone Star State. Had the Mango margarita and husband had regular on rocks. Mango was very good.  Meal began with chips and salsa. Did not have the heat but was okay. Shrimp fajitas were good with zucchini, mushroom, squash, bell peppers.  The rice was good but wish there had been more guacamole. Husband had enchiladas Verdes. There was a heaping amount of chicken in the three. We took two sopaipilla back to hotel.  Thank goodness we had refrigerator with freezer. Yum two large containers of vanilla ice cream. Half time ball game deserts!

photos.caption: Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Miguel&#39;s
Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chips and salsa
Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Daily specials

27umWK_hIn_3EuFQ4ni4YA.text: Not sure why this place is so highly rated. Stopped here for a quick dinner on the way to the airport and got burritos tipicos and enchiladas supreme. Food was straightforward and not much thought given to presentation, which is usually ok by me if the flavor wows. But the flavors were just ok, mostly salty.   The burritos were piping hot and cheesy and satisfying without being overly complex. They came with a pool of salty refried beaks and a side of shredded iceberg with a dollop of overly salty guac billed together as "guacamole salad." The enchiladas were barely warm and covered not with gooey cheesy sauce as usual, but with shredded lettuce and sour cream, which made everything soggy and cold.   The menu is huge so perhaps other items are much tastier but what's the point of a huge menu if you can't do all the items well? In sum, I've had much better Mexican even at this price point but I guess if you have to grab a bite in this area you could do worse than this place. The open breezeway seating is a bonus, as you can watch planes come in for landing close overhead.

IcceJzoI-ALh2QUNtAASPQ.text: Great food at screamingly reasonable prices.  Authentic cuisine with zero pretense.  It's the place I bring friends to when they come in from out of town because I know they'll love it.

4LHbGbNJRjxlt2yMece_4g.text: EDIT: I've been back twice since my first visit. Neither return trip repeated the first experience. I feel let down after getting excited about a decent place close to my office. Poor service and bland food are the norm here.  Good food for the price. I'm from OKC (with a lot of good Mexican and Tex-Mex food) and this place would stand up in the fierce competition of that market. I'm definitely going back.   My only complaint is the chips and salsa. Salsa was bland except for LOTS of salt. Chips were kind of mediocre as well. But these are minor compared to the great food I had.

t-cIGuowd1h_3CgGh8xTrg.text: Awesome place and a good example of why you shouldn't judge the book by the cover. I Was visiting from out of town and the hotel where I was staying near the airport told me there was a good Mexican restaurant down the street so I jumped in the car and headed that way. As I got really close I was a little hesitant because of the way it looked from the outside. Turned out it was awesome food and the wait staff was very nice.   I would definitely recommend going there to eat.

GdILHnfwmNOZS7kBiJ_i-A.text: This was a very good place to eat! Who would of guessed that this little place that looks crappy on the out side would be so good. I would have rated this five stars however, our waitress didn't talk. Over all great place.

2cabc_-wKjZvWqh0zhsh3g.text: Awful! Service is awful, food was awful, order was wrong. Do not go here, not worth ur money

QzMQxZQ01ejY3I4oxJDDHQ.text: Had to stay overnight in the area and the hotel suggested we try this place but that had warned us that is was a "hole in the wall" and that was exactly right. It could use some TLC.  Moving onto the food, they have a HUGE menu. So many meals sounded so good, I had a hard time deciding. We started with the queso and guac for an appetizer which was decent. Since it was a mexican place i did order 1 taco, I had to and glad i did. The people I was with had a pitcher of margarita also which they said was strong but good. For dinner I had the shrimp in garlic sauce which was delicious, a must try. One person though in my party did order the steak and cheese burrito which is not what she got.  We did not complain though, the waitress seemed like she really didnt want to be working that night. Skip desert, not worth the couple dollars, again we asked for chocolate ice cream and got vanilla...bummer!

CvAM695RSAxsKlI7jNwa9w.text: This place might scare you at first glance. But don't miss out!! Beer mugs are frozen. Beer is cold, service is friendly fast and food Is great!  It seems to be a family run business. It NOT a chain. It's not a shnazy place, booths and picnic tables. If you a foodie this is not a place to miss..if you are a snob..don't bother.. Again..great Mexican food!! Home made salsa. Everything is made to order.

photos.caption: Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Enchilada suprimo

5DM2ozzin05jdHLb5t0xXA.text: We were way underwhelmed by the food here, but we are from the west coast and get great Mexican food back home.  My husband was pleased with his blended raspberry margi, the tacos al pastor were ok but don't get the guacamole.  It's about the worst I've had.  I would give two stars, but the prices were low, so value-wise, it gets 3.

YTmpQDmDpVJPU0nyzdWuTA.text: South of the Border dinner with out leaving the USA. Had a great selection is authentic Mexican food including stuffed pablano and pork with salsa verde. They were both so good we ordered some beef and chicken tacos. One dish was better than the next. Drinks and service were both great.mWe are from Pa so unfortunately we can't eat here once a week but I will be going back again tonight.

8z8sB4U_Ne8zpxmZZR3xBg.text: I have been coming here since I was an early teen I'm now 23 omg I love this place so very authentic delicious. I don't go for the service or the ambiance lol but don't judge a book by it's cover this place is delicious! definitely in my top 5 favorite places to go in all of Charlotte!

s-nYP-hXGgH9ZsAt0Z-hCA.text: Total hidden treasure right here! Great post-hike/other strenuous activity food place. Food is so delicious and affordable. The chips and salsa - I have to watch myself or I eat too much before my actual meal comes, so tasty. It's a hole in the wall type of place, so not much to look at, but the service is friendly. And you might miss it using the address in Google Maps, it's just past where maps tells you the place is on the right.   Seriously, if you're ever in the area, def hit up Miguel's!

-fPLiBqTs4qgb1vJupINZw.text: Staying near the CLT airport and the options are limited.   Not sure why.   I was searching around and the reviews made me want to try it.   Loved it.   Sunday is fajita night, it was so smoky when I walked it from all the fajitas.  There is a "building" separate that has no windows for extra room.  It was great, it is a dump, the service is marginal that it's almost inviting.

o6nE-RygDYNbeCEfe3uNqg.text: One of the best places in Charlotte. Big portions. Just an all around solid restarting with great staff and great food!

64SQUb_G4yzzkhN_DBtkLw.text: I was a bit nervous due to some poor reviews. It this place couldn't be better!!! Enchilada verdes are awesome. Highly recommended!

sgyuYuTMjg1FqVpDiOFzhQ.text: Service was great.  Ordered the tostada de ceviche and the shrimp tasted frozen as if the shrimps didn't thaw in time.  Was not please with that but the spouse ordered tacos and it was delicious.  Their salsa was really good one of the best I had and their spicy salsa that came with the tacos had the right amount of kick to it.  I don't know if it was the owner or not but saw him refill someone's chip basket with his bare hands.  While the other ladies wore gloves while filling the chip basket. That was a no no on his part.  Ordered a spaghetti kids order to go for my son and he loved it!  I also tried it and it was one of the best spaghetti I had.

k3g-38XbfhAmF4j1MhhzLg.text: Food took a long time to arrive and then was underwhelming. Chilaquiles were indistinguishable from nachos and did not come with the promised beans. Beans are important to me. Waiter gave as little attention as he possibly could have, leaving my drink empty for the whole meal and never checking in. I caught him after I was done eating and asked for the check and a refill. He dropped a new cup of water off at my table, without ice or as much as a glance and then I waited a long while longer for the check. And then the register broke and the saga continued. I would not come back or recommend.

0XYMaVNhwlyNp1obJQ7oMA.text: Traveling for work and was famished as I landed in Charlotte. A quick yelp search suggested this restaurant and I thought I would give it a try.  I'm all for dive bars and restaurants but this place, located on what looks like a forgotten access road, had me saying, "no no no..." as I pulled in; I couldn't decide which was worse - the restaurant or the derelict motel next to it.  I was just about to pull out and figure out a plan B when I decided to throw in the park and take another look at the reviews; the restaurant received four out of five stars from nearly 100 diners, many of whom acknowledged that potential customers shouldn't let the aesthetics scare them off.  So glad I trusted these 100 strangers...what an amazing, flavorful meal! If I lived in Charlotte, I would be a regular.   My only bit of criticism is that I thought the staff could've been a little warmer but, hey, when your food is this good, you know people are going to come back.

-DrLy_GuILXCkW4DLle_aQ.text: Great food, but don't expect a smile.  This was my fourth visit over a 6 month span so while I haven't been detoured as yet my patience is quickly waning. A visit basically goes like this...  1)have a seat over there or over here -with a point toward an area of the restaurant, not with a verbal exchange  2) ok tell me what u want 3) here, eat your food 4) but don't ask for anything more 5) and don't expect a follow up visit -need another beer, more chips...oh well 6) then wait aimlessly for the bill to arrive 7) pay at the counter 8) ok, now leave   If you're expecting a great dining experience stay away from this place.

G5phjwrtIMTP9SCBrQnHPw.text: The old saying "Don't judge a book by its cover" holds True at Miguels.   My husband found this place on yelp and we decided to give it a try. The outside leaves much to be desired. Though the outdoor patio-esque area looked fun...However for a snowy NC dat, we sat inside.   We were immediately presented with menus and chips and salsa. We ordered the Speedy Gonzalez (special for the day for $4.50), Chili Relleno, and the chicken soup. Also got two dos equis drafts....Excellent price at $2.50!   The ranchero sauce on the enchilada was perfection. I also loved the refried beans. However the chicken soup was the winner for me. Great broth flavor and loaded down with chicken and rice. Exactly what I needed on a cold day.   I think our bill ended up being around $20 for everything. This place is the real deal and quite possibly jumped to my second favorite Mexican joint in the city!

rdl9p-8B54U3n01OuCULWw.text: Good family run Mexican diner right next to Charlotte airport. If you are staying at one of the nearby hotels, there are not many food options nearby, but Miguel's is a good place to check out. Good chips and salsa, tacos, and enchiladas. I also tried the chicken soup, which was good but wish the broth was hot (was served Luke warm). Very affordable prices and cute family run venue. Would return if staying at one of the nearby hotels.

photos.caption: Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken noodle soup

2VplatZZMuX83ZiWD4ISiQ.text: Delicious food - super authentic, lots of options and really good prices.  The locale you would have never thought to go here - underneath a billboard, gravel parking lot and almost looks like there couldn't be a restaurant there. The only compliant about the location would be if it could be a little bigger. But again, no frills or fluff, just straight up good food.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars, is that the service is not great at all. Barely even good. While some of the staff are nice, most of them are rude, don't even give you a smile when you arrive and then it takes forever for them to come back and take an order or check on you.

pJJEkdVdHOJtVXPtaPzAxw.text: I was very impressed during our visit to Miguel's. At the suggestion of a friend, we decided to make the journey to try this "hole-in-the-wall" place. Needless to say, the price was right and the food lived up to the expectations.  We got here early for lunch on a Saturday. We started off with $2.50 dos equis draft, speedy gonzales, chili relleno, and chicken soup. The whole meal capped out around $20 and was more than enough food for the two of us. The big winner for me was the chicken soup on this particularly cold day. It was loaded down with a ton of fresh ingredients and the flavor was awesome. I would certainly venture back out here again for lunch.  We got there right when they opened, but I have heard this place can get busy. Also they have a neat outdoor space that I would like to try when it is warmer sometime!

E2K1CzTjbzJuANdtf5WXBQ.text: I love Miguel's.. it's an easy go to that's close to the airport. I lived here 6 years ago and it was going strong then and still is.. I went in there tonight and saw some of the same waiters and waitresses I experienced 6 years ago.. that says something. The salsa has just the right kick. The tacos are like home. Such a go to

-z_7Ox9e5awj1fsBNb1H0A.text: Excellent for lunch and dinner!  Solid good quality Mexican food!  I work close by and we enjoy grabbing dinner from Miguels on the way home.

S7DYA1Y8Flpzz7AlIC6krA.text: I don't understand why there is so much hype for this place. It's subpar Mexican food. It's exactly what you would expect for the cheap prices, a cheap and basic product. Steak for the burrito is absolutely disgusting so I would recommend you stay away from steak as your protein.

HNpDW02Dvr1hbWjfI-BuBA.text: How this place got 4 stars is beyond me. I got the express burrito, first off how do you not know how to wrap a burrito? This was just open ended and was everywhere. Second don't cut a tomato in half and stick the half in a burrito, Mexican food is my favorite, and this was hands down the worst I have ever had. Wouldn't even feed this to a pet dog...

OXjo3pZXktS0ZWvZu6jLrQ.text: Damn good Mexican place. The place looks like a burned out motel -- everything you look for in a great Mexican place. Take one look at the ladies in the kitchen and you know you are in for something special. Order a cold one and get a frosted mug that turns your beer into slush. Enjoy!!!!

YHoHQMAf3aFWLlsRL2F6kg.text: I don't know why I never reviewed Miguel's until now. A True hole in the wall Mexican restaurant and I mean that in a good way 'cause the wife and I love places like this. Went Tuesday 1-22 to celebrate the wife's b-day with the daughter and granddaughter. This was the daughters first ever visit and she said she could not wait to come again. This is some of the best and most authentic Mexican food around and is worth a 30 minute drive from our house. One suggestion anything that comes with ground beef such as tacos, burritos ect, pay the 75 cents up charge and get them with shredded beef instead it will make them soooo much better. Everyone enjoyed their meals and service was very good. They brought extra chips with the cheese dip, checked on us often and promptly cleared empty plates.  Tried the flan on this visit even though we were stuffed and it was very good. Prices are reasonable with most combos running $8-9.  For the 4 of us including our meals, cheese dip, flan, drinks, tax and tip we got out for $38 which I thought was a great deal. One tip be careful because its on the I-85 service road. You turn off of Little Rock road between 2 gas stations onto the service road and you can easily miss it and if you do you will end up on I-85 south. At that point you will have to go all the way to next exit which could be in bumper to bumper traffic and make your way back to Little Rock road again which could add another 30 minutes to your trip especially if you get caught in rush hour traffic. This place is not fancy and like I said its a hole in the wall or dive, but that's generally were you can find some really good food and that's what you will find here at Miguel's

FpxNhbjK8tXo8JWRt0ZgFw.text: Pulling up to Miguel's makes one feel like they're about to enter a horror movie sequence. It's just that kind of vibe...and I'm glad. I'd like to say that it keeps away the crowds...but it doesn't. Miguel's is always packed.  If you haven't come here for lunch...you probably won't...but it is worth noting that two people can get in and out for under $10 total (with chips and salsa) by getting the daily special. Seriously...who doesn't like that?  The food here can range from great...to...so disappointed...but hey...always order the special and you can't really get too upset...can you?  I like Miguel's, the service is quick...no banter...just order, eat, get up and pay...leave. I've never been here outside of lunch since I'm not driving 30 minutes to grab Mexican.  If you haven't been here. Come here.  Try: The lunch specials (weren't you listening!)  Avoid: Getting here late in the lunch hour

VqzoHY_tqHTrMgr-l-EkUA.text: All previous reviews are quite accurate. I was on my way to catch a flight and was a little early and hungry. This place is "A Diamond in the Rough." I mean...you would not see it from the main road and it is literally sandwiched between a hotel and nothingness.   The people are about food. No small talk. No warm smiles. We were pointed, not taken, to a table. Their horchata is really good. The complimentary salsa and chips were also very good, with a bit of a kick. The waiter took our order which was a fajita taco salad and a regular taco salad. Both were good, but the fajita one was better. The only problem was I didn't realize that it came with guacamole. I usually ask about it, but I didn't see it mentioned on the menu so I forgot. Avocado gives me a gag reflex so I had to eat around it.   Not sure if we'll ever come back, only because of the location...but if we find ourselves on that side of town, I wouldn't object to a visit.

7-NbEyilLgBDLDL5CXSrCA.text: This is a MUST if your in the Charlotte area. Great hidden gem! You'll hardly know it was here but you'll be glad you found it once you taste the flavors.

CGTArzvLFL3aX6rDBTkEWg.text: This place is a hidden GEM !   DONT let outside appearance shoo you away !  This place has the most authentic Mexican food in Charlotte with more than reasonable prices.  Everyday they have lunch and dinner specials.  Don't let other " Mexican"  restaurants fool you with a fancy place and " authentic" dishes with overpriced dishes !  You want the True taste of MEXICO ?  Then look no further.

photos.caption: Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

SpwQnqZjL41Hgp0IAsrzuw.text: Authentic to the nines! Odd looking place from the outside but hey, as good as the food is, it is ok.

RVJ4tccmWEmN7u4tJnZjNQ.text: Authentic food is hard to find. This spot is a don't judge a book by a cover. Staff is courteous and food is True indeed cooked with love. As a native from San Diego this place brings back memories and good home cooked Mexican eats.   Caution -  drinks are not shy and poured strong that with any dish is a party waiting to happen. Drink eat and be merry.

BP1M9axG60Xihs0_hA9i-A.text: Ahhhh...yeah.....this place is the shit! Been going here for years for lunch. Absolute best Mexican restaurant in Charlotte. The steak fajitas are my go to, but every dish I've had has been delicious! Well done Amigos!

ZV_hmnK5jziKD9P-JnGnuQ.text: If you blink, you'll miss this hidden gem. Mistakenly went on cinco de mayo...it was PACKED! If the weather had cooperated, more people would've sat in the patio area. Since it was frio de mayo, everyone scrambled for a seat inside. My sister and I snagged two seats at the bar, scanned the menu and ordered. I ordered enchiladas rancheras. It was EVERYTHING! Two cheese enchiladas topped with beef & pork, onions, peppers. The flavor was intense and delicious. Not over powering and spicy. My sister ordered something with chicken, which she enjoyed. The pitcher of Margaritas Tejas could be why I don't remember what she ordered. A little sweet, but worth the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Margaritas Tejas...cuervo with grand mariner...I think

pgZOXt7E59kWBXUJ6dQi9w.text: Love the idea, concept, and ... well, the idea and concept.  Miguels was recommended by my hotel staff since I was staying at one of the 8 hotels on my street by the airport, and zero bars within walking distance. The hotel offered to drop me off here, since it is within their "radius."  Okay, so, the place is small. The beer is cold/good. Service was okay, food was meh. They were busy, so after I was finished eating my enchiladas, I would have felt awkward sitting in the booth having a beer when people were standing up waiting for a table. I just wanted to get my drink on... this is not the place for that.  Recommend in a pinch, but if you want to hit the drinks, take a $7 uber to Pinky's (where I ended up) or go downtown and have a plethora of options.

LHv7F_JvL9SNpzuCfRCDNA.text: Great little place near airport. Excellent food, beer, margaritas and daily specials. A find on this area

ykZKHh1Fa5NMDgQgnq_ZBw.text: This place is authentic as I have seen in charlotte. We have tried at-least 6 Other Mexican places and so far this is the best. Salsa was really good just a little spice but not so much you can't eat. The chorizo cheese dip was awesome. I got chicken chimichanga and were pretty good. They use shredded chicken but it actually had flavor as was cooked with onions and peppers. My husband got a pork dish and really enjoyed it. He suggested the homemade hot sauce. We topped it off with sopilla which you can't go wrong! Overall was good food. I gave 4 stars because even though service was quick the waiter was not very helpful when we asked for suggestions, just kept saying everything is good. But for a little mom and pop type place not too surprised.  We will return to try more.

D47GtMqocYE2lNpjIqdayA.text: Basic little Mexican restaurant with so so service. The food is reasonably priced and relatively good.   My favorite part about this place is their outdoor seating area. Covered booths with open air windows.   My suggestion for this place would be the fajitas, something difficult to screw up. The re fried beans leave much to be desired, they are soupy and bland. I have only had a few different entrees here, usually opting for the tacos or burritos when looking for a quick cheap lunch.   Miguel's was hard to find on my first trip there, you see it through the woods driving down Little Rock Rd. but the entrance is no where in site, not to mention once you do find it it's a little confusing being attached to a hole-in-the-wall motel next door.

jBW5GtEPZYWSymTxThUceQ.text: Great food!!!  Great service!  Great prices!  Authentic Mexican food in a casual setting. Three of us enjoyed three different entrees and all said we would definitely go back. Was close to the motel we stayed in while waiting for our next morning flight out of CLT.  Wouldn't stay in that motel again but will eat at Miguel's again for sure!

D9VI-_0xNHmXwNrKzmiAYg.text: You can tell by the crowd that this is a great place to eat.  Be prepared to wait for a seat, but it's definitely worth the wait!  Pork Carnival are my favorite!

5_8HdLslR7F8e93n9AFguw.text: Great hole in the wall Mexican gem in west Charlotte. Lunch specials may be best deal around.

zvX16ZxxLmBqgAbRClq7qw.text: Great local Mexican spot for cold beer and authentic food.

ABGu0PZ3VD-FautTiYXfxg.text: Miguel's is a pretty ordinary joint - canteen type place. Nothing special about it. The lady who served us was so cold & uncourteous, sitting at the restaurant for half an hour felt like a chore. Am not going back to this particular one for sure!

AkcJB9Ccu0KS7vYiU9wvSA.text: One of the best Mexican places in Charlotte, but doesn't look like much from the outside.  While it is in an odd location, the food is awesome and inexpensive.  Everything I have had here had tons of flavor.  The service was simple and fast.  It is a great lunch spot.  Go here.  You won't regret it.

4Nt06pcmnyF6qYM7-0F7wg.text: I've been to Miguel's over 10 times. I always take family and friends when they are in town. Everyone has always been super impressed. The food is always delicious. Service is OK, but not terrible. They always do their best to accommodate their customers, granted they are always slammed. My go to is ACP with black beans. Their queso and margaritas are a must!

kTk8f7XscDqV453dC4CdYQ.text: Miguel's is good for what it is: simple Mexican served on a simple place a TA really good price. I'm guessing that previous reviewers complaining about salt or the taste of the cheese have never eaten in Baja. The food is simple and tasty, just like is served in cantinas in Mexico. The taquitos (flautas, really) I had were simple, full of meat, and delicious. If your idea of Mexican is fajitas in Dallas, you won't like the place.

55GL2vqurQi8NPXQjV9uPA.text: A hidden gem who's exterior says "keep driving", but absolutely the best mexican food around.  The fajita's for two is fully loaded, and I have never found better.  The specials are good and cheap.  Their customers come from all over. Being near the airport, it is a great layover experience for travelers stuck in CLT.

PfO0KtY0BqGv70lNkrL6lQ.text: In my opinion Miguel's has the best Mexican food in Charlotte and their salsa is amazing. The prices are very reasonable and they offer daily specials.

xqMaAUzqB-zT5g__nQmmKw.text: Mixed review: chips and salsa were good, atmosphere good. I was told by my party that the chicken was good in the enchilada. My food, vegetarian burrito/cheese enchilada combo, was really basic and had no imagination in flavor. I was hoping to get a taqueria style burrito but what I got was small and boring flavor. The guacamole was tasteless and frozen, previously made. It was shameful that they serve that. Outdoor seating option was cool and it was very popular.

n3UJiCFY84oGO3R6c7VTOg.text: Wow! This place is phenomenal! I stopped in to grab lunch because I was craving Mexican food before my flight. The service is fast & it's right by the airport. The salsa is awesome!! Highly recommended.

0VAE8GwzLBNJK1uvRjCUTg.text: Excellent 'Dive-Mex'.  Easy to eat lunch for  less than $5.  Plenty of outdoor seating when the weather is warm

-OlrKkxoNfGCHKX6kPIAAg.text: Good Mexican food at low prices. yeah, it isn't Fancy, but I am so glad I found this little gem!  Thanks Yelp!!

CMIFz6vDtQ_NZ-ox__uBVQ.text: The first time I went to Miguel's I ordered the fajita plate. That was pretty good. The second time I brought my wife and we ordered the special Steak Burrito plate. We also ordered guacamole on the side. Nothing was authentic and nothing was fresh. The steak was like the Philly cheese steak you would get from a frozen box and the guacamole was definitely not fresh avocado. The chips and salsa... chips were made fresh as they were still warm and salsa could be freshly made but not sure. I was disappointed the second time. Not sure if I would go back. I can make better Mexican food than this place.

2vOp2KY1vPmlYd0P3wD7sw.text: I don't really see a problem with the ambiance.  It's a little hole in the wall place, and that's exactly what it reflects.  The patio area is actually pretty cool, but we sat inside.  The salsa was some of the best I've ever had, the drink specials were top notch, and the food was delicious as well.    I wish I could elaborate more, but trust me, the place is awesome.

vm_TjJfB6iZr66acb6ZQeg.text: This was the worst Mexican food. Everything was extremely salty.  The service was terrible.  The waiters said nothing to us the entire time. Do not go here. Ever.

HJgWwpWKImcLUTCsancgUA.text: Authentic Mexican  food served by good people at vertical reasonable  prices   Worth a visit

-62MXASVhPxeU66bFtQpbQ.text: Just moved from FL and we had a favorite Mexican restaurant.  We have tried 3-4 before we tried this place.  We arrived and it was busy.  Got a seat and then we ordered a pitcher of Texas margaritas witch were good not as good as our old place in FL but ok.   The food arrived and it was delicious.  I got the Miguel's fajitas and my husband got the choripollo.  He said it was better than our old place.  I loved the flavor of the fajitas.  Place is not fancy but if you want good food it's the best we have found yet.  People sitting outside to eat in 48 degree weather.  That should tell you something. We will be back.

pCgCsipAX_vAylrWru_iuw.text: Don't be afraid by the exterior! Lunch date here with my co-workers after our weekly meeting. First off...I really should have gps'ed the address because this place off the beaten path...or maybe too beaten. It's actually on an I-85 service road nestled between a chain hotel and an old motel. I must say I was a wee bit concerned when I got out of the car. But it was all good when I got inside.  I ordered the Quesadilla Rellino (sp) and a side order of guacamole. Of course the guac came out first and maybe its because I make a mean guacamole but this was a watered down avocado mousse with very little seasoning. I had to ask for a lime and shake some s&p before I could convince myself to eat it. Not okay!! My quesadilla however was awesome!! The chicken was seasoned so perfectly, I really could have eaten buckets of it. Overall, I will definitely try this place again san guacamole.

eU_nIvaJpFFHZXrFQaGTMQ.text: Miguel's has been in Charlotte along time. Pretty good food, but Margaritas are very weak. They look like watered down mix. So clear you can see thru them.. Don't recommend spending 7.50 for one. They should be frosty and look like lime..

S0fc0htzZh3ibjLVYqk0fQ.text: Yummy and affordable. Their queso is delicious. We sometimes go here for lunch but went for dinner and $2 margaritas when I dropped a friend at the airport and it was perfect. Great service too!

QBG0JNGrn4XUbo8vM1ZbCw.text: I took my daughter who was visiting from DC and discovered this jewel of a restaurant!  Ordered the margaritas,quest, chips , and salsa and immediately knew it was authentic!    It is clean no frills but friendly stomp sphere.  The tacos al pastor & chilies poblano a were absolutely delicious!  It is must visit when in the vicinity of the airport...just 5-10 minutes away!

I2liwoWzEAQe-W3bFGF1YA.text: Great authentic Mexican carnitas, they were delicious. However, it was HOT in the building. You might want to wait till the sun is down and sit outside in their patio area. Give them a try if you are in the area. I would definitely go back.

NbpbCxOhQtXKY22lnDzi8Q.text: Not impressed at all- would definitely not recommend wasting your money. Bland seasoning- presentation was sloppy. Hate to say it but I would rather eat at taco bell. So disappointed...

M7ftW8eeBk-2YOCpbYlE2A.text: Was staying at a hotel in the area so we decided to give it a try. Food was delicious and house margaritas were even better!!

jBDzX9ylPcMavdMXjTTjkw.text: Great spot! You wouldn't think it was something special when you drove up. But it was perfect. So close to the airport which was convenient. Food was really good.

MsyHyoBU1PNh6X0Ow3J4-Q.text: Being near my office, we frequent this place for lunch.   Service: outstanding. Always fast and friendly, with bottomless chips and salsa that actually get refilled.  Food: the food is standard Mexican fare, done simple and well. While you won't find anything truly amazing, everything I've tried has been delicious, well thought out, and ready quickly.  Value: this is where they truly shine. The prices are unbeatable for what you get, and the daily special gets you out the door for about $6, without leaving you hungry. Try whatever is on special that day if you aren't sure, and chances are you'll be pleased.

H6QU9aN8EX0Q_zZDu-Lhww.text: I think this place is awesome and not because it has my name!! I used to go to CPCC and I would eat here at least 2-3 times a week. The chips and salsa are great and so is almost everything else on the menu. Do not let appearances fool you, this place is special. The price is dirt cheap and the quality is 5 star. The Serrano special is one of the best dishes I have ever had. If in Charlotte you must try this place.

CR6Otorzslh1lBKRYFBr6A.text: When I first arrived in Charlotte the first order of business was where do I need to eat before going home and this was top on the list ( grilled cheese food truck is #2). We drive up to this hole in the wall style place with a wing of outdoor seating that was packed with people. We go inside and are met by our server who was very friendly. We ordered our queso appetizer as I begin to scour the menu for goodies. Settling on the enchiladas was an excellent choice! Overall lovely experience for a quick and reasonably priced meal. If ever in the area craving authentic style Mexican foods stop in and carb up!!

vz9mzLOaYxIT3RUXUoe9qA.text: Yes, it look like it should be in Mexico! But they have the best Mexican food of any restaurant Ive been to in Charlotte.  Food is always fresh and delicious. Service is always good and prompt.  Food is reasonably priced (and they have my favorite, chicken chimichangas on special on Wednesdays.. but I never seem to make it on that day) Miguels is actually the only Mexican joint i will go to.

4dNO1R8ViS4ed8YvmA07Pg.text: Cheap food, family-owned, good mexican beer, and even authentic desserts.  Careful not to overload on the orders though, this food really isn't all that good the next day.

6ld1JdZKceN2mAUsT4DwTw.text: Very solid dinner and drinks at Miguel's! Doesn't look like a lot, but is a good place.

sMbOSD07Mldc1JDjz5xBxQ.text: What a find not far out of CLT airport. Hidden away in the remains of an old hotel restaurant the food and service was tasty and fast! I will definitely stop here again when fly into Charlotte.

Az7TpsI8r2_DdKZ2-j4bTg.text: Good real Mexican food. Chimichanga with shredded beef was delicious. Only thing is that it didn't come with rice. It is not as hole-in-the-wall as expected. It's in the airier hotel area on top of a little hill.

_yaiQUujfudxy-04yoqrsg.text: Good little make you feel at home kinda place.... Beer is cold fast service, and only a short walk away from my hotel room. I would def be back when I 're visit Charlotte again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

aQdnnqKxg6A_l4oYgeZNqQ.text: As other Yelpers have mentioned, ambience is not a priority here. In fact, the outside felt a little like the Bates Motel!   However, the food is quite tasty and not expensive. I enjoy the taco combo with pulled beef, rice and beans.  My companion has tried the chicken taco salad, fajitas, burritos and enchiladas.  We have always found our food to be very yummy.  I've been here a dozen times and always see the same people working. They are also very generous with the chips and salsa, and they pour a biiiig ol' soda, which I appreciate-I hate to have to continually wave down a server for a refill when the soda comes in small glasses.  It can get busy, and I love to see all the different kinds of people willing to jam into this little space to eat some good Mexican food!

M8YBbzMNWBgwYky3vRxd-A.text: I very much enjoyed the food and the space. It is a "dive" restaurant, but I wish there were more places that committed to not being the same as everyone else. I'll be back

0XyrP6sTUHZe2KdhUFdvmg.text: It's okay. The chicken is tough the food is sloppy in my opinion. The rice is flavorful. I had enchilada and the sauce was just okay. The chicken wouldn't cut through.

eC5-nH6M_b-xA812iGeP_Q.text: My experience is not a reflection of the whole place.   I visited this place with my wife on a whim. I had heard about this place from a customer of mine and decided while we were in the neighborhood to try it out.  I knew this place was a hole in the wall type place which my wife and I enjoy. They have a small diner like interior with optional seating outside. My wife and I decided to sit outside.   We both went inside first to make sure we were doing the right thing and I spoke with a waitress and she asked us how many and then told us to have a seat anywhere. I said we would be outside.  We sat outside and was soon brought out chips and salsa. A minute later two Hispanic construction workers sat next to us outside, one of them went inside while the other sat down. Two minutes later a white couple did the same thing we did(go inside and then sit outside).   The couple who arrived after both pairs were brought chips and salsa, menus and was asked what they would like to drink. Meanwhile my wife and I and the construction workers had just chips and salsa.  Then a waiter came out and asked for drinks from the construction workers. At this point my wife was quite upset as we sat before both of the other tables. When the other tables waiter came we asked for at least menus and he said "oh your waiter is coming". Both my wife and I have worked in food services and my wife was a waitress and expressed concern that if a customer ask for a menu, no matter your section or not, you bring a menu.  Then one of the construction workers noticed that he hadn't seen anyone visit our table and asked if we had ordered already. We stated that we hadn't. And he said to us "that's wrong, they are getting waited on before both of us(pointing to the white couple).  At this point my wife was ready to go. I said let's wait one more minute. At this point a waitress went to the construction workers table and we decided to leave.   We didn't get to experience any of the food outside of the chips and salsa which was good/average.   It was a horrible experience but one that is not uncommon for AA restaurant patrons.

_215WXxHW1mcean2PuT2vA.text: Fun little place near the airport with quick friendly service. Staff seem to speak mostly Spanish so I felt at home (TX). I had a lunch special with 2 enchiladas and rice with a glass of water and got change back from $5. I can't remember the last time I could do that. Chips were fantastic, salsa was smooth and tasty. There are a couple of paved parking spaces, but is mostly gravel. I would eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. The white building is covered outdoor seating.
Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Signage.

E4L5zPY-UK2Xs2QCzLAFQw.text: I love the food at Miguel's but ordering take out sometimes can be a bit difficult. They don't greet you when you walk in. I waited about 3 minutes before I had to ask for a menu. She then slapped it down on the counter. Mind you I'm sitting at the bar in front of the register so all of the employees see me. If it weren't for the food I probably wouldn't come back cause the service is not the greatest. Although my experience before sitting at a table was a little better but not much.

T8hpWWgNryvE1-px69bCpw.text: Walked in to a lunchtime crowd, we looked around for a seat we're told we could sit anywhere, with a nod of the head no words spoken, no smile for that customer that's going to tip you. As soon as we  set down a woman flew by dropped chips and salsa on the table so fast that chips came flying out of the basket.  Are waiter came over and took our order. Meals came out fast and arrived well below my expectations!  My friend had  chimichanga  and I had the lunch stir-fry, as I don't eat meat I asked for mushrooms there was not a mushroom to be found.  I've visited this establishment twice before it was three years ago and I am 99% sure that I had a different experience because after this one I will not be back.  Next time I decide to have Mexican I will take the  seven minutes drive to Taxco  Mexican Grill!

photos.caption: Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Daily specials
Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch specials
Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

gjXB9HbsFKi8QhAYBX7RkA.text: Food was fantastic. Service was horrible. Place is a dive like everyone else states. Ordered the pomponas Chile and was really happy with the overall taste. Took 15 minutes after getting it to get tortillas and never got a refill on my tea the whole time we were there. About an hour and 15 minutes

I8bkvAXnk-PtREJdcs38Uw.text: The service was fast.  Within 2 mins of walking in I was given a menu, asked if I had any questions.  I placed my order within minutes because I always look at the menu before going to a new restaurant since I'm pescatarian. Small Pina Colada Daquiri and tilapia burrito. The only negative thing I have to say is that I ordered a small pina colada daiquiri and  the waitress put it in a bigger container. I guess I could of confirmed if it was a small, but since the prices were all so good I just assumed it was more bang for your buck!

photos.caption: Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

lAXl_V3PMB3Xp45ifibO7A.text: Great dive. Food was good, some of the chicken was a bit tough but nice flavors. Pollo con Crema excellent but plate was unusually small. Wings were tasty. Service is fine and fast. Servers seem a bit bored but were attentive. Place was packed. Full bar!!

photos.caption: Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wings

id_jNPGDfs-f687PhONokg.text: I came here because I saw all the rave reviews. It's definitely a hidden gem. Don't be scared of the interior and exterior.The food is cheap. The salsa is good. The food was good and you get it very quickly! The only thing I didn't like was the service. Our server was slow and they weren't even that busy. There was one time where I asked him for something and he kept walking off without stopping or looking. I thought he didn't hear me but he did end up bringing what I asked for. We also had to ask for refill drinks. Maybe it was an off night because the other servers were pretty attentive to their tables.

NsqVRPkthDtY-H4YIH89Jg.text: Queso is impeccable & GREATTTT margaritas. Authentic, inexpensive, & great service. My new favorite spot in town!!!!!

3UtaobqKdOexCIylwiEo8Q.text: Some of the best Mexican food ever. Enchiladas verde with carnitas was amazing! Don't be put off by the funky location.

J5DsohQLZx_JOxlVoqehnQ.text: Again, I was so hungry and didn't get a picture of my food!  Miguel's is consistently superb, both food and service (and drinks)!  My favorite combo plate always hits the spot!  Go by and say hello to Miguel!  Their homemade sauces (especially enchilada) is good and authentic. You can't go wrong with anything.  Their daily specials, whether lunch or dinner, are a great time to try something new!

8Qf4pi8iBn99SvLLCIq2rQ.text: I live so close and I would have never stopped here if not for the reviews on yelp. It looks ROUGH on the outside. The food is delicious tho. That's all you need to know

I73e32JK3J9Ea-QIZ57HkA.text: Best Mexican I have had in a LONG time. What a relief to find a little nostalgia - a happy sanctuary from the business traveler's restaurant chain doldrums. Atmosphere offers off the beaten path food experience melding old school diner and Bordertown Mexican.   Grab a chrome stool at the counter/bar or slip into a red leather booth and dig your way through authentic south of the border cuisine while checking out the wall decor. The building is interestingly quirky- open-air outside dining room roofed but likely too hot unless there is a nice breeze. Inside for the dining room or full bar. I went ala carte with a beef taco, chicken quesadilla, and chicken tostada (so hard to find good tostadas; the chicken was perfect blend of chunks and pulled - no gristle).   Great service coupled with great location adjacent Charlotte Douglas International Airport. Oh, and the prices are ridiculously low. Try something different and check it out!!! Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

s0VB92cxjVa-fAZWGtcDCQ.text: Small, dive-type "hole-in-the-wall". Very fast service, great for a quick bite. I had the huevos con chorizo, very tasty. Giant Dos Equis Amber on tap, $5...huevos and grande Cerveza--what's not to love?!?!  Very good chips/salsa...will try adding the queso blanco next time. Refried beans were excellent, too, and the rice was light and flavorful, bonus!  Definitely worth a pop-in if you're near the airport and in a rush!

DViq40aEFKEL9tbUsUTPOQ.text: Authentic Mexican!!!  Don't let the location or the building fool you, it's a hidden gem...a very well hidden gem. It's a small whole in the wall, but as usual those are the good places. The food was great! They have indoor and outdoor seating. The service was also good, and according to my friends who I tagged along with, the coca-cola there is amazing too!

ECDDfxs3WPWh4Ruzq_HMtg.text: Great little hole in the wall we found passing through Charlotte on our way home from the mtns.  Nice waitstaff,  fast service and good food.  Can't beat $4.99 lunch fajitas on Sunday.  We fed our family of 3 a big lunch for what it costs to buy a meal ar McDonald's.  Will definitely remember this place on our next trip through the Queen City.  If only we could've had one of their margaritas!!

KsZVi_k-dGx4cnMVRvjD4Q.text: This place is definitely unassuming, and somewhere you'd just drive by....if you can even find it nestled next to the Wingate hotel, but don't let the appearance or location stop you from coming in! It is definitely my husband's and my favorite "dive" Mexican spot. It's absolutely no frills, but the food is cheap (and tasty) and the beer is cold!   There are combination platters to try a little of everything, which is what I did, but there's also specialities and deals of the day. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu, but I definitely recommend starting with either the guacamole or the scream cheese! It's definitely a gem in the rough in the charlotte food scene that's worth a nibble or two!

TQTOnwNdSoH9_FqNnXjq5A.text: Good, fast, clean Mexican food.  Don't let the appearance of the building dissuade you.  If you are staying at one of the airport hotels, stop in for some fajitas.  Oh and the prices can't be beat.

3i2rFf0wq5HILaHUqYu9QA.text: I was split between a three and a four star review. The salsa was watery and bland, the dinner entry was good, and the service was good. Nothing spectacular here, and I didn't hear any of the other diners speaking Spanish. There weren't many authentic choices such as lengua, menudo, tripa, or cabeza offered.

tco8KUxlrM2zUJxlOAzq4w.text: It's my first time here.  You know the saying about first impression?  Well, I came here based on the reviews & sometimes the best gems are holes in the walls.  This is NOT one of them.  I ordered some kind of an imitation guacamole paste, hate when restaurant give fake food.  they delivered my spicy shrimp & never once checked on me.  When they gave me my check there was no thank you not even gracias!   I think a robot could be programmed to be more polite than the people here.

K1BeXZ6WHX7dshPLaa2Z-g.text: Great food! I called in an order to take back to my hotel room. Affordable, local, delicious! Decent amount of vegetarian options. Was pleasantly surprised to find chips and salsa in my bag as an added bonus! Would definitely recommend.

PF3JxxkWI6i30-5u9x8hmQ.text: Really?  Read the reviews. Would have been almost enjoyable if there was service. Crabby server. She said total of five words. Got my order wrong. Avoid us like the plague. Ate what I could.  Worst burritos ever.  Runny beans. How do they stay in business?  Best part was sitting outside.  I am all for supporting local. But this place needs work.

IIRczzUxQ8RwLua9XTQBkQ.text: Walking distance (right next door) to the Wingate, and there's a nice outdoor seating area.  I had the carnitas.  It was a little overcooked, but the flavor was good.  Service was so-so, I'd go back if I have a lot of time to eat, but not for a quick trip.

YcQfAd3g4dkrlgYmgItWAg.text: This is the worst Mexican restaurant I have ever been to. I am from Texas and I know great Mexican food. The service was not good and the chorizo was the saltiest I have ever had. I am now eating a bowl of ice cream just to get the taste of their food out of my mouth. Don't go there......run away!

1ImDqj1WbOAc-jV-RdV4pQ.text: I have been to this wonderful hole in the wall restaurant so so many times. The food is ALWAYS on point and the price is even better. The very first time I was brought here, by my best friend, I expected to be disappointed. Simply for the fact that it is so run down. It is a very small building with limited seating. They also have tables outside. But I'm a loyal customer now. They staff is friendly. The food comes out hot AND delicious (EVERY SINGLE TIME). They make a bomb mango margarita. My best friend and I call this "our spot". About a month ago, the boo was in town and he pulled up Miguels without my suggestion. He asked me about the place and without hesitation I said, "Let's go!" He was also impressed by this place. You definitely CANNOT go wrong here. Much love to all the wonderful people who work here and create such great food!! And of course, I'll be back!!

O8p3kRSVORoiTxRtwcgHQQ.text: If you, like me, have a deep affection for hole-in-the-wall Mexican food, then look no further. My husband and I love sitting on the patio at this place and the food was great. There's just something about a local place like this that can't be beat.

IHUWMRbQ8_EaEZNqAmofhg.text: Miguel's was recommended By the locals. My steak burrito was good. Some in our group had tacos that looked less me they were straight from Taco Bell wit these hard shell and ground beef. If you are use to West Coast Mexican food, wait until you return there. It is really different.

Nx_yhLmRZa_UGpCgZ-4aHw.text: Found this on Yelp while traveling. Don't judge by the looks. Food was authentic Mexican. Good quantity and quality. Chips are home made and crisp. Marinated pork in green sauce is awesome.

bu_j7OHA6uY8TShRe__NFw.text: I am in town from Ohio and the place was recommended by a local... Place looks like an old run down hotel but the service was fast food was great and beer was cold... Would recommend to anyone... 5 stars if not for the building...

wnkdE8CdgnsjENJiph9-tw.text: They have the best enchiladas of anywhere I have tried. If anyone knows of better ones let me know but at the moment these are king of the hill.

uw_CeIRzJKRpXgFLe91Rjw.text: PEOPLE BEWARE!!! Do not be fooled by these reviews! This place is a joke at best. I am from this area and would have to say that this particular establishment is hands down the worst experience you will EVER encounter!!! Honestly I have no earthly idea where or how these wonderful reviews come about! I've been to EVERY Mexican restaurant in the Queen City and without doubt this is the bottom of the barrel! The wait staff act as if their last job was at the DMV!! Horrible service, less than friendly would be putting it mildly!!! Totally reminded me of a Mexican soup nazi attitude!!! Do yourself a favor and mark this one off the list!!! Azteca, taco veloz and carnita's is the way to go!!

wfS9QTXZBlMs-YXORfQiTw.text: We almost didn't stop here just because of how bad it looked but we decided to take a chance.  It was actually really good and very cheap.    Definitely worth the money!

PoFLLXiYI6gLXAI86GLm-Q.text: Nice little hole in the wall Mexican joint. Good food, cheap, clean little restaurant that was built from a home.

b6C2iYPjSv_SRotDM6eeig.text: By far. The best food all over! I never have to guess where to eat when in the area. The daily food specials and drink specials are consistent and posted on website. No frills and flashy gimmicks, just great food!

_JCOe9xwoywkkupvz7NBdQ.text: Service wasn't the greatest, it seemed I was an inconvenience to be waited on. My waitress kept returning to her perch at the bar. Another table she was waiting on finally gave up getting their check and left cash on the table when they left. The food was typical frozen Tex-Mexican affair the salsa had an abundance of garlic salt in it making it quite pungent. It seems drink specials are a favorite here. I would not come here if you are looking for good authentic Mexican food and a friendly atmosphere. Go to Pacos Tacos instead, better food & service for the same price.  After posting this review and reading the other low star reviews it is apparent that the service is horrible here and not just a one time affair. Go else where.

kMCXpBzvLEo_oo2vY34pRA.text: Great hole in the wall Mexican restaurant! Don't let the building or decor send you away. The food is really good. You can also dime inside or outside. Friendly staff and quick service.

9SK-Sh62fI1oIyA3ECdOjg.text: Had the tilapia burrito. They were really good!!! The waitress was really nice. Get ready for it if you ask for the big beer, it's huge. Even the chips they gave us before were tasty. The place isn't fancy or doesn't look very appealing but the food is totally worth it especially if u are in the neighborhood. I put 4 out of 5 just because I've had better Mexican food and if it hadn't been recommended I probably wouldn't have gone, but definitely had a good experience

LV-S0avraonWOjlW-nXJpg.text: Miguel's doesn't try to be something it's not. It's a dive, a whole in the wall. Whatever cute name you come up with for a spot that gives you what you come in here expecting. Good food at a decent price.  It's not trying to be a fancy Tex Mex place with craft beers on tap and a tequila menu. It's greasy food, cheap beer and that's all you should need if you pull into their parking lot.  They have a few TVs to keep your mind occupied so you don't look at the outdated decor.  I've been here a dozen times and it's always good. The service is blah, but I didn't come here to be wowed by a wait staff. Just give me my al pastor and no one will get hurt.

1srt-FZiS6tBgvOttq1GJQ.text: Ok,  I'll preface this by saying I am from Cali where the Mexican food is awesome.  That being said, this was lame from a food perspective but even worse from a service standpoint.     Sat at the counter ter to be easy.  Git a beer, chips and salsa stat.  Took my order and it went south from there.    Long story short:  Nine tables.were served that came in after me, yes I counted.  I ordered fajitas, supposedly a signature dish.  Brought the beans, rice, and fixings one minute, 10 minutes later the tortillas, and 15 minutes later the fajitas.  Tortillas and fixings were cold by then.  The fajitas didn't even have fajita seasoning on them so I dumped my salsa on top to add something to give them flavor.  All restaurants have a bad night, but this was way beyond that.  Go to Taco Bell.

A2f4OqBcMzvvnW3zL9jLag.text: I love finding small non-chain restaurants that most traveling public would pass by. This is one of those places. From the outside, at a quick glance, it does not seem to be a restaurant, although it does have a covered outdoor seating area. We walked in, looked around, seemed like the place could seat around 50 people inside. They do serve beer wine and liquor. Without looking at the menu, I asked our waiter (as he was serving us chips and salsa), if they had pork burritos. He said they did offer "Serrana Burritos dinner." I ordered it. The chips and salsa are fairly standard in taste, not a lot of spice in the salsa. The burritos came with Mexican Rice. The pork was really flavorful, and also inside was sauteed green peppers and onions . And the sauce on top, though I cannot describe it, was a nice bonus. This place had a lot of character. If you are coming/going from the Charlotte Airport, check this place out!

3XE1Y0BoncQ7Oh0CQDkyEA.text: A completely no frills Mexican restaurant that serves food up quick and cheap. It's located in a secluded part of town, not too far from the airport.  Miguel's is quite small but it does boast a nice-sized outdoor enclosed patio. The inside does not have A/C, at least it didn't on the day I visited which was a warm day. A basket of chips and salsa are provided - for free - while you take the time to go through their large menu. I decided to go with chicken fajitas and a glass of white sangria.  The white sangria legitimately tasted like Moscato. There were no fruit pieces in the glass. Again, no frills and it was $3.75. The chicken fajitas were served the typical way on a sizzling skillet, with mushrooms and squash in addition to the normal peppers and onions. Tortillas served on the side along with a scoop of pico and rice and beans.  The waitress didn't seem particularly thrilled or interested in to be providing service but it is what it is. I can't say I'd rush back here but it was decent food at a low cost.

Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken fajitas

gJZTeTYpzIjpjoTH-ZaU2g.text: There is nothing fancy about this place...... and that's what I like lol. The food comes out super quick and the prices remind me of the 80s lol.  Overall, great!

VYh2lm0xUvvuZrb0rGQJeg.text: Helloooo new favorite Mexican restaurant!   After spending the day shopping, we were looking for some good Mexican food so we turned to Yelp and ended up at Miguel's!  The sign isn't very vibrant, so be careful you don't miss it and don't judge a book by it's somewhat off-putting cover. There is nothing fancy about the appearance of Miguel's, but they do offer outside seating in a covered area which is great in sunny weather.  Complimentary chips and salsa were good - I'm a salt feign, so I was craving more, but really these were good as is.   We both ordered the Sunday drink special: Half Pitchers of Margarita for $8.99. What a great deal! Drinks came out quickly and tasted great.   Miguel's offers a large menu with plenty of options, I chose the dinner special - Chicken fajita's with rice and beans for $8.99. Again, the food came out quickly. It was served on a sizzling skillet with warm tortillas on the side. Chicken was cooked well, the veggies (onions, green pepper, mushroom and tomato) were grilled and seasoned well. Service overall was okay and food was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sunday Special: Fajitas $8.99
Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half pitcher margaritas $8.99 on Sunday

9QarCqY7E4b-ALQ5jn1utw.text: I was so excited when a friend told us about Miguel's. I'm from the Texas area and use to a certain kind of Mexican food that I have not found in the Charlotte area and the way they described the food sounded exactly like what I love, was use to, and was looking for.   The restaurant is in a bit of a strange location and is quite rough around the edges. The staff is generally annoyed with everything. BUT the food is amazing and a great price. First, chips and salsa are included which is for some reason, so rare in charlotte. The salsa is perfect and not too spicy. It's what I grew up eating and I was so happy to taste it here! The rice and beans were perfect, creamy regrows beans with Mexican, orange rice. The tacos were so good, with that finely ground beef with cogito cheese sprinkled heavily on top. The beef burrito was so satisfying, it's ground beef, rolled in a tortilla with cogito cheese on top with red sauce. RED SAUCE. For some reason read sauce doesn't make an appearance at charlotte Mexican restaurants and it breaks my heart. But Miguel's knows what they're doing and has the perfect recipe for it.   I had a margarita as well, it wasn't amazing, definitely not fresh lime juice, but it was cheap and worth it.

lK5oecKhM9F-R6cRe9s9qw.text: This is a joint!  Clearly popular -- it was packed on a Sunday night, next to the freeway, by the airport, gravel parking lot -- this place will give you Mexican food. The digs are not fancy, so don't get too excited. They are fast, friendly, and inexpensive.   I'd like to see fresh chips - that's the secret sauce, err, salsa of the best Mexican joints. That would be a great upgrade. The large beer is no joke... be ready to drink. Also, the hard shell tacos would be far better if the corn tortillas were fried up, but so it goes.

i2_tOtVyrG3y5at0OxtnHA.text: Late dinner on a Friday night, it wasn't too busy and the service was decent. I was brought a basket of chips but the salsa didn't follow for a little bit. This delay was a little odd, but I got over it.  I ordered from the specials board, an arroz con pollo. It didn't take long and it was brought to me. A very good portion, plenty of grilled onions and peppers and chicken and, for some reason, mushrooms. It worked though, especially the sliced avocado.  Inexpensive meal, even with a Corona. I'd go back here for sure.  Miguel's is really, really close to the entrance to the Charlotte airport. It's not fancy.

photos.caption: Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Miguel&#39;s Mexican and American Restaurant near CLT

Flu2KKKOoplDTHg1eSM6Zw.text: My favorite Mexican spot in Charlotte.By far the best tacos in the area. Great prices.

taiacrpat1UeAdlxw5iYoA.text: I had heard good things about this hole in the wall, so when a friend suggested we go here after a trip to the white water center, it sounded like a good idea.   You should definitely know what to expect before coming here. It's not fancy and it's definitely a hope in the wall. There were a few people there when we got there, but we were seated right away.   They start you off with complimentary chips and salsa. They weren't there best I've had, but after a long day outside, they hit the spot.   I got the enchiladas de chorizo. I enjoyed them, but I thought it was missing something. For enchiladas they seemed plain. My two friends got the fajitas special and my husband got the chorripollo. They all loved what they got.   Unfortunately, the service was pretty bad. When we got our food, the fajitas were missing all of the toppings they were supposed to come with. By the time we could get someone's attention and they bright it out, we were almost done eating. Then when we went to the counter to pay, we must have waited 15 minutes for them to help us. It definitely seemed like they were short staffed.   I would come back here again and would recommend checking it out if you're a fan of whole in the wall, authentic, Mexican restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chorizo enchiladas

HVq71xYqsHxSVLCCwGytLg.text: The absolute worst mexican food I have had in many many years. If you are going to make something called camerones a la diabla maybe make the shrimp at least appear to be slightly spiced. Also after asking 3 times for some hot sauce you failed to even bring me anything. My taco also had a rock inside but I would let that slide if the rest of the meal resembled mexican food.

ppM2uh94XypqudFEvRQydA.text: Came here the other week because we were told this place was amazing and we wanted authentic Mexican food..very disappointed..only thing I liked was the salsa but my husband hated that too.   Not horrible food but VERY BLAHHHH food!!  VERY VERY HORRIBLE SERVICE!!  When we tried to order our drinks she was inching away while we tried to order, she only came back to give us our food or something, she never once talked to us and the men waiters (2) ran into me and my two young children two times with no sorry or excuse me..   Honestly I have no idea how this place has 4 star or why we were told it was amazing food (by two families)  My husband wishes we just spent the $30 at Taco Bell  we should have gone to on the border instead!  Also I forgot we ordered some margaritas and mine didn't even taste like it had alcohol in it...   -WILL NEVER RETURN-

yIxDAgJ0X5X8_QVEGN28fA.text: Delayed flight: This is great little Mexican food restaurant near the airport. Miguel and his family  are from Mexico they make authentic Mexican food! If you're in town or not make this a pit stop today! Great prices, service, and food!

eAGfORv0-0OalQXRAGqg6w.text: I was really expecting to love this place. I arrived and its a dumpy structure in a poorly graded gravel lot where people park anywhere they can find space. It was somewhat crowded on a Tuesday but I got a seat at the bar. Service was sorta slow although I was in no hurry. The salsa had the consistency of ketchup and was not all that great. The michelada was OK, had better. I had a bowl of the Azteca soup that was pretty decent and then got a enchilada/taco combo plate which arrived at the same time as the soup. The enchiladas and taco were uninspiring to me. Sorta bland. Everything had this plain ground beef in it. Was not my favorite Mexican joint.

0Ip0t56hcCAcrUDOS_D2ew.text: Very good and also reasonably priced. Small divey place with really good fajitas. My friend got the cheese and said it was really good too.   The place has indoor and outdoors.

photos.caption: Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

nr_beNovlkdltX0Dcnt-3A.text: One word: obsessed. One part hidden gem, one part dive bar, all parts freaking awesome.   Miguel's is definitely off the beaten path: it's about two miles from the airport off Little Rock Road on the service road. It doesn't look like much. It's small random house next to the Wingate Hotel. They have a cool outdoor covered seating area as well.   They have $4.25 lunch specials every day. On Sundays, there's a $4.99 fajitas lunch specials. They also have drinks specials every night as well as dinner specials that start as low as $5.99. Don't mind me, I'm the girl who gets a lunch chimichanga AND a chile relleno on the side (while consuming an entire basket of chips).   Note: Chips and salsa are free if you are dining in, there is a charge for to-go orders. It's worth it, the salsa is homemade and delicious.   They do take credit cards. The place is small, so take that into consideration when making lunch or dinner plans. Tonya and I went yesterday at 11:30am and it was the perfect time.

photos.caption: Photo of Miguel's Mexican and American Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch chimichanga (soft)

zEWq332muSTPzU7xLOFkSQ.text: Ahhhh Cinco de Mayo! A great holiday. When I read the reviews here I was pretty excited to try it. I pulled up and immediately thought "what did I get myself into?" Lol!! I promise it's wonderful, so go in. The outside is nothing to look at, I would normally pass by and not give it another thought. I'm glad I gave it a chance.  The menu is huge. They have daily specials, even on the weekends, which is fantastic. I ordered a cheese quesadilla, beef tostada, and of course chips and salsa was served with it. The hound beef on the tostada was absolutely delicious. It tasted like it had marinated all day in a broth. Very, very good...and I'm NOT a meat person. I have a feeling I will be craving this place again soon.  One start off for the waitresses was not happy or friendly at all.  Maybe she was busy, I don't know, but I wished she would've been nicer.  She did work hard, so I will write it off.

My favorite thing to get is the El combo. It's a nice sample of some favorites and you just can't beAt the price of it.
